intro: Vittadinia spechtii var. kimberleyensis, commonly known as Kimberley everlasting, is a flowering plant native to the Kimberley region of Western Australia. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and grass-like leaves. The plant produces showy yellow flowers that bloom in spring, attracting various pollinators. It thrives in well-drained soils and is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments. Vittadinia spechtii var. kimberleyensis is often found in open woodlands and along riverbanks, showcasing its ecological significance in the region.
